page.title: 14Pitlour and Newhill
page.content: { Pitlour}belongs to the{Skene family. The name{Pitlour}is{pre-Gaelic}and means{Boar Hill.}The part of the{ {Estate}within our{block}consists of{ {Pitlour Hill- 122 acres}of rough grazing, not in regular use;{78 acres} of mixed woodland; the Policies round the house_{73 acres}of permanent grazing let to{Mr. R. Mitchell}and{ {Wester Pitlour,}which is farmed by{Mr. {D. Bell. Wester Pitlour (310 acres)} is semi_hill land used for grazing{800 {sheep}and{180 beef cattle}including{2 {pedigree Simmental bulls.}The{animals can stay out all{winter}as the fields are sheltered by the{woodland areas. Mr. Bell grows{60 acres of barley}and{ {50 acres of hay. { Newhill ( Mr.}and{Mrs. DuBoulay ) {consists of 10}acres of very poor land on which{3 ponies and 15 orphan lambs {are kept.}It was once a{poultry farm.
